newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia shares up, Lek leads the way.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia shares up, Lek leads the way.

text.p: Slovenian shares rose on Thursday, boosted by a big jump in drug maker Lek.
Market participants said gains could extend into the coming, with optimism after the central bank's decision to relax foreign investment rules unlikely to fade quickly.
* The SBI index rose 1.06 percent or 15.31 points to 1,459.7.
* Issue C of drug company Lek was the top gainer, jumping 10.0 percent to 30,250 tolars on volume of 27 shares.
* Lek's issue A, which is included in the SBI index, jumped 9.92 percent to 31,900 tolars on volume of 11,224
* Food company Kolinska was the most active, easing 1.74 percent to 2,200 tolars on volume of 49,042 shares. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
